thread.title: Mexican Antitrust Commission Closes Probe of Railroads

author: Anthony Harrup
title: Mexican Antitrust Commission Closes Probe of Railroads

organizations.name: mexican antitrust commission closes probe of railroads mexico city

text:
MEXICO CITY—Mexico’s antitrust watchdog said Thursday that it has closed an investigation into a possible lack of competition in interconnection services among the country’s principal railroad operators.
The country’s two largest rail operators, Grupo Mexico Transportes, or GMXT, and Kansas City Southern, had objected to a preliminary report on the matter from the Federal Economic Competition Commission’s investigative arm in September of 2016.
